issue.title: [Java] provide platform specific jni and jar for Java bindings
issue.body:
This PR attempts to archive wasmedge-java bindings into platform specific jars.

closes #2234

comment.body:
> No, I mean if you didn't rebase on the `master` branch and let CI runs on it, the result of the PR might not even compiled after merged. Therefore, I believe rebasing is required.

rebased to current master.

Changed `loadLibraryFromJar` to throw relevant `RuntimeException`s. The reasoning is that I didn't want to introduce breaking changes to the signature of `WasmEdge#init`.

Also, it's not `"/"` meant in the OS `"/"` way. In this case, it looks for the dynamic lib at root of the jar archive (`"/"`) and copies it to `/tmp/wasmedge_jni_tmp/` in the actual filesystem.

closes #2234

issue.title: Added top-level read-only permission to github tokens for all workflows
issue.body:
**Issue:**  #2979

**Steps taken:** 
As described by the **remediation steps**  in the documentation of [ossf scorecard](https://github.com/ossf/scorecard/blob/main/docs/checks.md#token-permissions), the following changes have been performed:
* Added ```permissions: read-only``` at the top-level to every workflow of the repository
* The following change should not break existing workflow jobs as job-specific permissions are specified in the job description itself.
* This change will only ensure that new jobs created within the workflow will have read-only permission if no permissions are specified at the job-level

**Results:**
When checked for the score of ```Token-Permissions``` check, the initial result was 0/10, with details like (for all workflow files):
```
Warn: no topLevel permission defined: .github/workflows/IWYU_scan.yml
```
After changes:
The score for Token-Permission check: 10/10
![image](https://github.com/WasmEdge/WasmEdge/assets/56017960/d8c8ff44-a244-4d14-b649-291ae83c5afd)

comment.body:
## [Codecov](https://app.codecov.io/gh/WasmEdge/WasmEdge/pull/2984?src=pr&el=h1&utm_medium=referral&utm_source=github&utm_content=comment&utm_campaign=pr+comments&utm_term=WasmEdge) Report
> Merging [#2984](https://app.codecov.io/gh/WasmEdge/WasmEdge/pull/2984?src=pr&el=desc&utm_medium=referral&utm_source=github&utm_content=comment&utm_campaign=pr+comments&utm_term=WasmEdge) (b70c5df) into [master](https://app.codecov.io/gh/WasmEdge/WasmEdge/commit/ffdf6dec53352c6f8d2ebe445c2344c604c90c24?el=desc&utm_medium=referral&utm_source=github&utm_content=comment&utm_campaign=pr+comments&utm_term=WasmEdge) (ffdf6de) will **increase** coverage by `0.01%`.
> The diff coverage is `n/a`.

```diff
@@            Coverage Diff             @@
##           master    #2984      +/-   ##
==========================================
+ Coverage   80.91%   80.93%   +0.01%     
==========================================
  Files         150      150              
  Lines       21630    21630              
  Branches     4353     4353              
==========================================
+ Hits        17502    17506       +4     
+ Misses       2962     2959       -3     
+ Partials     1166     1165       -1     
```


[see 4 files with indirect coverage changes](https://app.codecov.io/gh/WasmEdge/WasmEdge/pull/2984/indirect-changes?src=pr&el=tree-more&utm_medium=referral&utm_source=github&utm_content=comment&utm_campaign=pr+comments&utm_term=WasmEdge)

:mega: We’re building smart automated test selection to slash your CI/CD build times. [Learn more](https://about.codecov.io/iterative-testing/?utm_medium=referral&utm_source=github&utm_content=comment&utm_campaign=pr+comments&utm_term=WasmEdge)
